reasoning: The tree design involves checking if the robot says 'EXCUSE ME' (gesture code 4). If it does, Human 1 gives way to the robot by using the GiveWaytoRobot action and continues to avoid the robot until the robot is no longer nearby. If the robot does not say 'EXCUSE ME', Human 1 does nothing and continues standing in the group.
tree:
<root main_tree_to_execute="Human1GroupTree">
    <BehaviorTree ID="Human1GroupTree">
        <Fallback name="RobotInteractionFallback">
            <Sequence name="GiveWaySequence">
                <RobotSays agent_id="{id}" message="4"/>
                <GiveWaytoRobot agent_id="{id}" time_step="{dt}"/>
                <Inverter>
                    <IsRobotNearby agent_id="{id}" distance="2.0"/>
                </Inverter>
            </Sequence>
            <!-- Add any action or condition here if the human continues to stand in the group, if needed -->
        </Fallback>
    </BehaviorTree>
</root>
